# SyntheticEvent { #flood_adapt.objects.SyntheticEvent }

```python
objects.SyntheticEvent()
```

BaseModel describing the expected variables and data types for parameters of Synthetic that extend the parent class Event.

## Attributes {.doc-section .doc-section-attributes}

<code>[**time**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[TimeFrame](`flood_adapt.objects.events.events.TimeFrame`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The time frame of the event.

<code>[**template**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[Template](`flood_adapt.objects.events.events.Template`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The template of the event. Defaults to Template.Synthetic.

<code>[**mode**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[Mode](`flood_adapt.objects.events.events.Mode`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The mode of the event. Defaults to Mode.single_event.

<code>[**rainfall_multiplier**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[float](`float`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   The rainfall multiplier of the event. Defaults to 1.0.

<code>[**forcings**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[dict](`dict`)\[[ForcingType](`flood_adapt.objects.forcing.forcing.ForcingType`), [list](`list`)\[[IForcing](`flood_adapt.objects.forcing.forcing.IForcing`)\]\]]{.parameter-annotation}</code>
